SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.jpws.pwslib.data
Class PwsRawField

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRawField
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class PwsRawField
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

A RawField contains a cleartext (decrypted) value of a single PWS data field (as it typically occurs in a PWS file). Similar to the type String, RawField behaves largely as a constant and after creation of an instance its value cannot be altered, except by destruction. Data getter methods discriminate properly for blocked and unblocked data and length.

As for its cleartext status, RawField is inapproriate for storing sensitive data like e.g. a password.

RawField is used primarily in rawfield lists (e.g. the HeaderFieldList) by input and output handling classes, or as a uniform interface to storable PWS fields.

Since:
2-0-0
See Also:
RawFieldList, HeaderFieldList

Constructor Detail

PwsRawField

public PwsRawField(PwsBlockInputStream bs,
                   int format)
            throws java.io.IOException
Constructs a rawfield by reading its content from a PWS input blockstream. The stream is advanced for the number of blocks that define the next field.

Parameters:
bs - PwsBlockInputStream
format - the file format version (interpretation schema)
Throws:
java.io.IOException

PwsRawField

public PwsRawField(int type,
                   byte[] data)
Constructor for a rawfield with a length value and content identical to the parameter byte array. The byte array may be of any size.

Parameters:
type - 0 .. 255; the field data type (convention of the PWS-File definition)
data - content of the field (any length); may be null in which case length 0 is assumed

PwsRawField

public PwsRawField(int type,
                   int length,
                   byte[] data)
Constructor for a RawField. length defines the length of the field value independently from the size of the supplied data block.

Parameters:
type - 0 .. 255; the field data type (convention of the PWS-File definition)
length - the length of field data (in bytes)
data - source of content of this field; any length (missing content will be supplemented by zero bytes); may be null
Method Detail

makeTextField

public static PwsRawField makeTextField(int type,
                                        java.lang.String text)
Creates a rawfield from a text string. The encoding used is UTF-8; if encoding fails, a runtime exception is thrown.

Parameters:
type - 0 .. 255; the field data type (convention of the PWS-File definition)
text - content of the field as a text string (any length); may be null in which case length 0 is assumed
Throws:
java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if UTF-8 is not supported by JRE
Since:
2-1-0

makeTimeField

public static PwsRawField makeTimeField(int type,
                                        long time,
                                        int length)
Creates a rawfield for a standard time value. Time is passed in universal epoch milliseconds, but the field value stored is is in seconds (= div 1000). (Time is represented in Little-Endian manner as an integer value ideally of 8 or 4 bytes length.)

Parameters:
type - 0 .. 255; the field data type (convention of the PWS-File definition)
time - long time value in epoch milliseconds
length - length in bytes of binary integer representation (minimum 4)
Since:
2-1-0

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Two raw fields are equal if and only if their type and data values are equal.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
true if and only if obj.type == this.type & equalData( obj.data, this.data )
Since:
2-1-0

pwsFieldBlockCount

public static int pwsFieldBlockCount(int datalength,
                                     int format)
Returns the number of data blocks required to store a PWS data field according to the formatting rules of a persistent state (PWS file).

Parameters:
datalength - length in bytes of usable data of the field
format - format version number of the persistent state
Returns:
total number of data blocks required to store the field
Since:
2-0-0

pwsFieldBlockSize

                                    int format)
Returns the total data size in bytes required to store a PWS data field according to the formatting rules of a persistent state (PWS file).

Parameters:

Returns:

writeEncrypted

public void writeEncrypted(java.io.OutputStream out,
                           PwsCipher cipher,
                           int format)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Writes the contents of this rawfield to an output stream, encrypted by the parameter cipher, blocked and formatted according to the PWS rules for the specified format version.

Parameters:
out - target data output stream
cipher - PwsCipher (writing direction)
format - the PWS file version format (for values see class Global)
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeEncrypted

public void writeEncrypted(java.io.OutputStream out,
                           PwsCipher cipher,
                           int format,
                           PwsChecksum checksum)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Writes the contents of this rawfield to an output stream, encrypted by the parameter cipher, blocked and formatted according to the PWS rules for the specified format version and optionally updating a checksum object.

Parameters:
out - target data output stream
cipher - PwsCipher (writing direction)
format - the PWS file version format (for values see class Global)
checksum - a PwsChecksum which gets updated by the data content of this field; may be null
Throws:
java.io.IOException

destroy

public void destroy()
Erases the contents of the data array and sets all values to zero. After this, the field has no further meaning, sensitive data been effectively cleaned out.
